message.body: Hello webfoot, you're back! I was just regretting falling off yesterday. We're having a harrowing roadtrip and using my phone to solve problems constantly. 4 hrs from Philly and just about no money for gas, tolls, or food and no sleep. I guess that's how it goes.
Just take the toll roads, it's like deliverance on the side roads out there
So where r u from you never said or if you don't want to that's understandable
Oh no are you stuck on the side of the highway right now?
I could send AAA
It's ok, thank u stranger. We happened upon the bank that I needed to find to cash a check. I'm originally from upstate ny. You?
I'm from finger lake region sw of Syracuse
Are you from real upstate or Yonkers upstate
Which is actually down state
To most of the state
Broome County upstate, touching PA but no NYC culture. Fingerlakes is nice. I know what u mean about fake upstate tho. White plains? No way jose.
Yeah ppl from NYC don't know what the real upstate is
Do you know Chris Lawrence? He's from near there
I do kinda. Our moms know each other.
I know Chris' mom
I don't actually
So are you driving back to Philly or somewhere else
I'm just catching a greyhound to Binghamton and picking up my van to drive to Richmond to get ready for a show.
Art show, with giant bat bikes?
We're you in the truck show at the ice box last year

Yes, but no. Some sculptures and costumes and sound and performers. I have to cut down these big carbon fiber things and figure out how to get em back together to get through a standard doorway. Sucks. I would've just turned it down, but if I figure it out, it opens up possibilities to show it elsewhere.
I'm hoping I can do it for as close to $0 as possible.
No. I know there the only place without a tiny door problem, other than Little Berlin, but a rental gallery is out of the question.
Found material is the only way to make large scale sculpture unless you are a rich kid
Big doors are a plus
I think I know who I'm talking to now
Noooo
You probably do
I don't know who you are
Just ask Chris's mom
Just joking
You probably don't know me
I don't think we've ever met
I'll ask my mom to ask his mom
So what are the carbon fiber things you are cutting up
They're these drapey triangular peaks that have speakers mounted in them.
That sounds cool.
Did you record sound pieces to play through for them
*through them
A friend of mine from Richmond did. We had a number of meeting in which I described what I wanted without a competent sound vocabulary.
I've recorded some sound stuff for installations and it was super fun. I got to scream a lot and play with chainsaws
I like screaming the best
So where did you go to grad school?
Vcu
I went to penn.
How was vcu's program
Penn was ok but I definitely wouldn't have gone if the hadn't paid for me
It's crazy how much that place charges
I went to undergrad at mica and paid for that though. I'm still paying for that and will be for a long time.
I also did a postbacc program at goldsmiths in london before penn. it was only a 1 year program
That makes sense bc I don't really know anyone from Penn. I was in the sculpture program, which is great solely for nonfigurative sculpture, and unbelievably ignorant about anything else.
Did u know Nigel Roth at vcu's
Not really. I've met him, but that's it.
He's quite tall
So do you live Virginia more than Philly?

I did, but I'm graduated now. Just this last show. I'm not really in Philly either. I'm working in Minneapolis occasionally, have this show and a residency at art farm Nebraska in Sept, and am going on trips and crashing with my family in between. In oct, I'll move to ny.
Sounds like a fun summer. What are your plans for ny? Do you mean NYC or upstate?
NYC. I don't really have any plans, just have to go somewhere. Philly's great, but I'm done dealing with the revenue dept.
NYC is whole other batch of problems/ opportunities I guess.
It was always way too expensive for me. Especially when I started doing large sculpture because so much space is needed

They randomly tried to sue me for $10k right before BPT was reformed, even though I worked with a Philly accountant the whole time I lived here. I won with a volunteer lawyer, but bombed a show in the process.
And now they're looking for me again even though I haven't lived, worked, or intersected with money here in 2 years. No thanks.
Huh that's crazy. I haven't had any problems like that here, knock on wood.
Yeah, they tried to sue a handful of random artists at once to see what came of it, then the tax was reformed.
Did you have a business in Philly then
I'm pretty sure NYC has higher business taxes than Philly

Yeah, I don't know yet how I'll manage. I imagine there will be a gap of time in which almost nothing is possible. I'm trying to buy some dirt cheap landwith the first time buyers' program and build a barebones studio shack on it 2 hrs upstate. The mortgage would be half the price as a closet-sized studio. I'll just have a studio in the city if it miraculously appears from an LMCC application or something.
You're safe
Good to hear that I'm safe!
But I don't make any money to speak of off of art in Philly
Not much of a market in Philly

No, but I was paid on 1099 as an individual, which nearly everyone low-income is in Philly. It gets messy with BPT because only an experienced Philly accountant can fill out the forms bc they're so convoluted, plus it costs $75 a year just to pay, or $300 for a lifetime license. NYC reformed business taxfor 1099'd individuals long ago.
And business tax is definitely lower overall there even for big biz. Comcast only relocated bc Philly gave them an exemption to try to change that perception.
The things I make are too ephemeral to be purchased for the most part.
Huh, well lets hope that never happens again. Sounds like a nightmare
Yup, but over now. I think I nearly have a good combo of collectible and ephemeral. I'll just see where it goes. I want toile a play next.
Oops, to make

Ah my friend in Berlin did art direction and created sets for avant theater in NYC for a bit. She would fly back in the summer and build these cool inflatable sets with autonomous flying components that responded tho the audience and stage action

Awesome. Berlin makes sense. Theater there is more likely to be invested in the stage magic. It's way more focused on the craft of acting here. I was inPoland over Christmas break to check out the theater. Pretty rad.
What's her name? I'd like to see.
Hannah Dougherty, but she's originally from Philly, we met at mica.
I want to go to Poland! I'm half polish and want to see Warsaw where my grandparents lived before WWII
There are a lot of foreigners doing that in Warsaw especially. I think if you're foreign, they kind of assume you're researching Jewish heritage.
I guess that makes sense
But my family was not Jewish but had Jewish friends which they helped hide so my family lost all property.
My great grandparents were killed and my grandparents and uncles were sent to a work camp
I think my great grandparents were sent to buchenwald.
Wild. Both times I went to Europe, it was striking how current ww2 seems still. I guess it is here, but the evidence is invisible.
They were wealthy before the war but were dirt poor when they came to America because all there money and property was taken destroyed
How did they manage the passage?

My grandparent parents and uncles were sent to a work camp making bomb shells and then after the Americans liberated the camp they came to the US as refugees because they had no home or money in Warsaw
I think the army brought them over
But my mom was born here after the war
Do you know Matthew Maycock? He curated a show at Little Berlin about 3 yrs ago of polish and polish-American artists. He was living in Warsaw for awhile.
Yeah I know him a little bit. Didn't he move to NYC
I don't think I've ever talked with him about being polish but I knew he lived there
He always had good shirts
I'm not sure. I just knew he was there recently. I miss that guy, so amiable. He's been wearing Hawaiian shirts for like the last 7 or 8 years.
And studying fruit flies.
I hope I catch him there and talk about Poland.
That place is chock full of amazing homemade traditional polish food and beers diiiirt cheap.
So many 4 course meals with beers for two under $15
Yeah I remember seeing him a lot at the berks warehouse years ago and much less recently in w Philly.
He also used to teach midnight math or something at PIFAS.
Almost to Scranton for my 2 hr layover
I think he's a programmer
I'd like to talk to him about Poland too.
What place is chock full of amazing homemade traditional polish food and beers diiiirt cheap ? Poland?
Tessa
Yesss? Thank u autocorrect
That sounds cheep.
Did you ever go to the polish restaurant / bar on allegheny ave called new wave?
In Philly
It has polish beer and food and the weirdest paintings of outer space meets Hokusai's wave meets digitalization.
All the guys at the bar wear track suits and gold chains and are polish gangsters.
The food is real good, it's made by one old woman and the kitchen closes at 8 pm sharp.
Sometimes after the kitchen closes the dining area turns into a polish disco.
The room is mirrored and they play euro techno, it does not feel like you are in America at all.
Finding things was really hard and cryptic, but that made it better.
Whoooooooa no I had no idea. I must go next time.
I'm afraid I'll get addicted.
It's not that easy to get to and the area isn't great so I don't go very often
Sometimes you get the feeling you are not welcome by the guys in track suits
The inaccessibility keeps it classic
But that whole area On allegheny is a polish neighborhood
Something about that must be cool though, like when one unfamiliar tough guy walks into a bar full of other tough guys.
East of the el
I didn't know. I used to work in a flag factory near there
But I did not explore
I'm not so tough so I wouldn't know
Ah did you go to shows at adventure island
No, I kind of missed that boat. Wish I did though.
Maybe you have the force like that kid at the end of wet hot American summer
The savior
New wave is close to adventure island
You mean the kid at the talent show who makes the satellite crash?
What makes you think I have those sorts of powers?
Yes that kid. There could be a compensation for lack of toughness. I'm trying to be positive here.
I wish I could make satellites fall to earth, I'll just have to settle for making sphinx's out of broken glass and golf balls.
Although its not a great defense
What is your super power?
That sounds like it'll do. I keep thinking you're Howard because of the artwork, but I know him?
Preternatural understanding of late ripe motives
What? ALTERIOR
I don't understand my new phone at all.
Yours?
Mine's more of a curse
I had a flip phone for 6 years and just got an iPhone , I nearly returned it before I left the store.
So you know everyone's motives ? Even mine?
No, your texts are not informationy enough.
They have sparse evidence of attitude
So I'm safe... For now.
No, forever
No Philly livin again
I do have a bit of an attitude but it comes out more when I am not face to face with someone. I am pretty shy around people I don't know or self conscious anyway.
Usually you find out eventually that shy people are bubbling over with 'rude
'TUDE
At least in person, not when I'm texting
Oh no I'm just taking it out on texting partners!
Sorry bout that
I can't help myself, I'm a monster
It's ok to victimize the faceless, like coral.
It hasn't been my best day
I suggest heading to new wave, or karaoke, just to watch since you're an introvert.
Watching karaoke is awesome
It's good advice but I have to adjust some photos in photoshop tonight
No rest for the wicked I guess
Well ok. I have to keep riding in vehicles forever and ever
If I don't have a pulmonary embolism after all this, I'm invincible.
That sounds better to me
Maybe that's your super power
I don't clot
It's just hemophilia.
Well when put that way it doesn't sound so super
It's a Blooper Dour
I don't know what that is
I made it up. I don't know either.
Rhymes with super power, but sounds like a downer
A comical sedative ?
Sure. Speaking of them, I found the seat with the most legroom, so I'll probably be falling asleep soon. Clot on.
Sleep tight. Thanks for the interesting conversation
I hope you got to your destination without experiencing any serious medical issues.
We are all kinda superheroes without healthcare ...if we don't get sick that is.
